oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Delaunay-type singular solutions for the fractional Yamabe Problem
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: DelaTorre, A.
del Pino, M.
Gonzalez, M. d. M.
Wei, Juncheng
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Mathematics - Analysis of PDEs
Mathematics - Differential Geometry
35B33
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: We construct Delaunay-type solutions for the fractional Yamabe problem with an isolated singularity $(-\Delta)^\gamma w = c_{n, \gamma} w^{\frac{n+2\gamma}{n-2\gamma}}, w>0 \ \mbox{in} \ \mathbb{R}^n \backslash \{0\}$ We follow a variational approach, in which the key is the computation of the fractional Laplacian in polar coordinates.
